page.title: 11THE BUTCHER'S SHOP
page.content: The butcher's shop is built next to an old black,thatched barn. They used to slaughter the animals in the barn themselves but now they buy their meat from Humphries in Braintree. There is one butcher and three part-time workers who start work at 8am and finish at 5-30. They close for an hour from 1pm to 2pm and close all afternoon on Monday. There are 2 chill rooms and 2 freezers where beef,pork and lamb are kept.Eggs,some tinned food and a small amount of frozen vegetables are also sold. Breast of lamb is the cheapest meat they sell at 30 pence a pound and fillet steak is the most expensive at Â£3.70 a pound. Most of the customers call into the shop to buy their meat,but some people ring in their orders to be collected later. The butcher will also deliver meat to customers at their houses.
